TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataGridViewSortCompareEventArgs extends System.ComponentModel.HandledEventArgs

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SortCompare> event to provide custom sorting. This event occurs only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataSource%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is not set and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.VirtualMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set to `false`. This event occurs once for each pair of cells in the column being sorted. It occurs only when the user clicks the header of a column with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.SortMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnSortMode>, or when you call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Sort%28System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn%2CSystem.ComponentModel.ListSortDirection%29?displayProperty=fullName> overload. When this event occurs for a column with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.SortMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnSortMode>, you must display the sorting glyph yourself through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.SortGlyphDirection%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
You can use this event to sort rows using the cell values in one column or in multiple columns. Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSortCompareEventArgs.CellValue1%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSortCompareEventArgs.CellValue2%2A> properties to compare cell values in the column specified in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSortCompareEventArgs.Column%2A> property. Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSortCompareEventArgs.RowIndex1%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSortCompareEventArgs.RowIndex2%2A> properties to access values in other columns through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Rows%2A?displayProperty=fullName> collection.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SortCompare> in a multiple column sort. This example is part of a larger example provided in [How to: Customize Sorting in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
[!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SortCompare#10](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.d_58_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SortCompare#10](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.d_58_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: public DataGridViewSortCompareEventArgs (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn dataGridViewColumn, object cellValue1, object cellValue2, int rowIndex1, int rowIndex2);

Docs.param: The value of the first cell to compare.
The value of the second cell to compare.
The index of the row containing the first cell.
The index of the row containing the second cell.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets the value of the first cell to compare.
Docs.value: The value of the first cell.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is typically used in conjunction with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSortCompareEventArgs.CellValue2%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of CellValue1 in a multiple column sort. This example is part of a larger example provided in [How to: Customize Sorting in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets the value of the second cell to compare.
Docs.value: The value of the second cell.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is typically used in conjunction with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSortCompareEventArgs.CellValue1%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of CellValue2 in a multiple column sort. This example is part of a larger example provided in [How to: Customize Sorting in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
[!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SortCompare#10](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.d_117_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SortCompare#10](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.d_117_1.cs)]

## Remarks This property is useful in determining and controlling sort behavior in programmatic sorts.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of Column in a multiple column sort. In this example the ID column is used to determine the final order if there are identical values in the sorted column, so no additional sorting will be done if there are duplicate values in the ID column. This example is part of a larger example provided in [How to: Customize Sorting in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
[!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SortCompare#10](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.d_160_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SortCompare#10](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.d_160_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets the index of the row containing the first cell to compare.
Docs.value: The index of the row containing the second cell.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is useful when sorting rows based on the cell values in multiple columns.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of RowIndex1 in a multiple column sort. This example is part of a larger example provided in [How to: Customize Sorting in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets the index of the row containing the second cell to compare.
Docs.value: The index of the row containing the second cell.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is useful when sorting rows based on the cell values in multiple columns.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of RowIndex2 in a multiple column sort. This example is part of a larger example provided in [How to: Customize Sorting in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
[!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SortCompare#10](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.d_161_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SortCompare#10](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.d_161_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the order in which the compared cells will be sorted.
Docs.value: Less than zero if the first cell will be sorted before the second cell; zero if the first cell and second cell have equivalent values; greater than zero if the second cell will be sorted before the first cell.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this value is typically the last operation you will perform in a handler for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SortCompare?displayProperty=fullName> event. You will typically set this value to the return value of a comparison method such as <xref:System.String.Compare%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of SortResult in a multiple column sort. This example is part of a larger example provided in [How to: Customize Sorting in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
[!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SortCompare#10](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.d_269_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SortCompare#10](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.d_269_1.cs)]
